description: From Latin ferīnus, from fera (“wild animal”). The zoological sense was coined by William Whewell in 1840.

adjectives.description: ferine (comparative more ferine, superlative most ferine)

entries.meaning: (now rare) Pertaining to wild, menacing animals; feral.
examples: the season of rutting (an uncouth phrase, by which the vulgar denote that gentle dalliance, which in the well-wooded forest of Hampshire, passes between lovers of the ferine kind)  […]

entries.meaning: (zoology, obsolete) Belonging to the proposed taxon of bats, carnivorans, and insectivorans.
(zoology, obsolete) A member of the proposed taxon of bats, carnivorans, and insectivorans.
